channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats begin calls for Schumer's ouster after some in his caucus fold on shutdown fight
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Charles E. Schumer could be in hot water with his party after Sunday's bipartisan deal that is expected to end the government s...

item.title: RFK Jr. Probes Health Dangers Of Offshore Wind Turbines
item.description: While offshore wind farms’ effect on marine life has garnered much attention, the human element has been largely neglected.

item.title: Humanity Can Still Learn From ‘The Father Of History’
item.description: Emily Katz Anhalt's latest book, Ancient Wisdom for Polarized Times , makes a powerful case for relearning the lessons of Herodotus.

item.title: Trump Deserves Credit for Focus on Nigerian Christians
item.description: But the prospects of major U.S. intervention in this situation are grim.

item.title: Outrage At Harvard Grade Inflation Report Reveals The Rot In Higher Education
item.description: Individuals can most excel when asked to do so, and Harvard should embody that call to greatness.

item.title: Trump Stadium? Commanders fans greet president with mix of boos, applause
item.description: President Trump withstood a thoroughly mixed greeting from the crowd at Sunday's game between the Detroit Lions and Washington Commanders in Landover,...

item.title: Putting Our Humanity Above Politics
item.description: It’s necessary now, especially after last Tuesday’s election results in New York and elsewhere.

item.title: Troubles Mount for the ‘British Biased Corporation’
item.description: Amid the resignation of senior BBC officials, the debate on how to save the broadcaster rages on.

item.title: Virginia’s Democrat Sweep Endangers The Lives Of Millions Of Unborn And School-Age Girls
item.description: The victory of so many pro-abortion candidates means that more extreme bills will be passed in upcoming General Assembly sessions.

item.title: Mamdani’s Vast Support Among The College-Educated Tells Us All We Need to Know About Higher Ed
item.description: New York City’s election suggests that higher education must undergo significant changes to prevent socialism from taking over America.

item.title: Who are the 8 Senate Democrats voting to reopen the government, and why
item.description: Eight Senate Democrats voted Sunday night to end their party's filibuster that has kept the government shut down for 41 days and counting.
